HERO_DESCRIPTION: Conversation links can be embedded in other applications that support oEmbed or embed.ly. Create one here.
INTRO_TEXT: Enter a name for your conversation, or page, below, and we'll provide you with a URL that you can use to embed FastComments in other applications.
ERROR_NOT_LOGGED_IN: You must be logged in to create an embedded conversation link.
ERROR_NOT_TENANT: You must be logged in as your tenant to create an embedded conversation link.
ERROR_LOGGED_IN_AS_COMMENTER: You are currently logged in as a commenter.
FAQ_WHAT_CAN_DO: What can I do with this?
FAQ_WHAT_CAN_DO_ANSWER: This allows you to take our live, customizable commenting widget and embed it in other applications like Notion or Google Sites. Learn more about this here.
FAQ_HOW_MANY: How many conversations can I create?
FAQ_HOW_MANY_ANSWER: Currently, accounts are limited to two million conversations, however this can be increased upon request.
FAQ_NEED_FOR_WEBSITE: Do I need to do this to add FastComments to a website or custom application?
FAQ_NEED_FOR_WEBSITE_ANSWER: No! This is only for integrating into products that support embed.ly. If you want to add FastComments to WordPress, or a custom site, you don't have to create conversations manually. See our installation docs.
FAQ_BELONG_TO_ACCOUNT: Do embed links belong to my account?
FAQ_BELONG_TO_ACCOUNT_ANSWER: Yes, embed links are tied to your tenant.
FAQ_IS_PRIVATE_ANSWER: In order to function, the links used to create embedded conversations have to be publicly available. However, the URL contains a uniquely generated ID to make it difficult to guess.
FAQ_NEED_OEMBED: Do I have to use this with an application that supports oEmbed?
FAQ_NEED_OEMBED_ANSWER: Not necessarily! You can use this to create a link to simply chat with, and send it to a group.
